Package io.crums.sldg.packs

Class MorselPack

java.lang.Object
io.crums.sldg.packs.MorselPack
All Implemented Interfaces:
EntryBag, MorselBag, PathBag, RowBag, TrailBag, io.crums.util.hash.Digest
public final class MorselPack
extends java.lang.Object
implements MorselBag

Implementation of a MorselBag using a composition of row-, path-, trail-, and entry-packs. But note, unlike those classes, this actually must validate the business rules (the subcomponents are kinda ignorant of the larger business rules: they only guarantee well-formed-ness within their own confines).

What's not validated

Beacon rows and Crumtrails reference external resources (hashes) that require a network connection to validate. It would be too onerous to include these checks every time an instance where instantiated, so these are left as a later step in the data validation process.

Also, we haven't hammered out exactly how an Entry's hash is computed. For this reason, validation does not include matching entry hashes to that advertised as in the ledger row's input hash.

Serial Format

Rationale for the existence of BAG_SIZES array is that we want to be able to random access any of the morsel's sections without having to read the whole. This is to support future capabilities; we don't actually need this right now. (Recall, each of the bags is self-delimiting anyway.) 

    BAG_COUNT   := BYTE (current version is 4)
    BAG_SIZES   := INT ^BAG_COUNT
    MORSEL_BAG  := BAG_COUNT BAG_SIZES ROW_BAG PATH_BAG TRAIL_BAG ENTRY_BAG

  • Method Details

    • load

      public static MorselPack load​(java.nio.ByteBuffer in) throws ByteFormatException, HashConflictException
      Loads and returns an instance from its serial (binary) representation.
      Parameters:
      in - caller must not modify contents since much is not copied. On return, the position is advanced by the size of the data used. (Caller is free to modify positional state, just not the contents of what was just "read").
      Throws:
      ByteFormatException - if the data appears to be structurally non-sensical (e.g. read a a negative count)
      HashConflictException - if the data contains conflicting hashes (aka tampered, or broken)

      public java.nio.ByteBuffer rowHash​(long rowNumber)
      Description copied from interface: RowBag
      Returns the row-hash for the row at the given number. The eligible input arguments are both from the full row numbers and also the row numbers of rows they reference.
      Specified by:
      rowHash in interface RowBag
      Parameters:
      rowNumber - a member of Ledger.coverage(getFullRowNumbers()) (note this includes row 0, where the sentinel hash must be returned)
      Returns:
      32-byte hash
